data.title: North Carolina State University
data.text:
Awards

2004 ACC Male Athlete of the Year

2003 ACC Player of the Year

2003 ACC Offensive Player of the Year

2003 first-team All-ACC, 2002 second-team All-ACC

2000 ACC Rookie of the Year

Four-time bowl MVP (2 Tangerine Bowls, Gator Bowl and Senior Bowl)

Retired No. 17 jersey (2003)

Four-time Pro Bowl selection

San Diego Chargers 50th Anniversary Team

Individual Records

NCAA-record 51 consecutive starts at quarterback.

Ranked second all-time in NCAA history with 13,484 career passing yards at end of career; still ranked fourth all-time.

Tied for seventh in NCAA history with 95 career touchdown passes.

Owns nearly every significant passing record in school and ACC history, including game, season and career marks for passing yards, total offense and touchdown passes.

Team Records

2000 MicronPC.com Bowl champions, fifth in ACC (8-4, 4-4)

2001 Tangerine Bowl participant, fifth in ACC (7-5, 4-4)

2002 Gator Bowl champions, fourth in ACC (11-3, 5-3)

2003 Tangerine Bowl champions, fourth in ACC (8-5, 4-4)

General Information

First-round pick of the 2004 NFL draft by New York Giants; traded on draft day to the San Diego Chargers.

Led Chargers to AFC Championship game with 14-2 record in first year as a starter.

Five-time Pro Bowl pick

His career NFL passer rating of 95.7 ranks 5th all-time for quarterbacks with at least 1,500 pass attempts.

Chargers franchise leader in TD passes, passing yards, pass completions, and pass attempts.

Ranks fourth on the NFL career list for consecutive starts.

2012 NC State commencement speaker.
